intro: Hieracium brachysceles, commonly known as the short-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it has hairy stems and basal leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in early summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium brachysceles is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
